page.title: 19COBHAM NEWS AND MAIL
page.content:
Dawn Slough, a reporter with the News and Mail, was interviewed about stories which were developing after the week ending 10th July 1985.
She said that,with the closure of St. Andrew's Secondary School, there was a row brewing about who should pay to bus the children from Cobham to their new school, Trinity, in Esher.
The following week there was to be a story about a missing person that the police were after.
The details of the proposed new routes for the Heathrow - Gatwick link helicopter (which affects the Cobham area) would be published.
